citation.article-title: Pedobacter suwonensis sp. nov., isolated from the rhizosphere of Chinese cabbage (Brassica campestris)
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pedobacter suwonensis sp. nov.
Pedobacter suwonensis (su.won.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. suwonensis referring to Suwon, the city in which the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative and rod-shaped (0.65×1.4–3.2 μm).
After 2 days on TSA, colonies are circular, 2–4 mm in diameter, smooth, convex with entire margins and pinkish yellow.
Grows well on R2A, TSA and nutrient agar, but does not grow on MacConkey agar.
Cells are aerobic, non-motile, non-spore-forming and mesophilic.
Growth occurs at pH 5.0–8.0 and 0–3 % NaCl, with optimal growth at pH 6.5–7.0 and 0–0.5 % NaCl.
Grows at temperatures in the range 1–37 °C, with optimum growth at 34 °C.
Positive for catalase, oxidase, protease (hydrolysis of gelatin and casein) and aesculin hydrolysis.
Negative for lipase, urease, arginine dihydrolase, indole production and nitrate reduction.

Utilizes l-arabinose, d-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, l-rhamnose, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin, salicin, d-cellobiose, d-maltose, d-lactose, d-melibiose, sucrose, d-trehalose, d-melezitose, d-raffinose, starch, glycogen, β-gentiobiose and d-turanose as sole carbon sources.

Enzymic activity is observed for alkaline and acid phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase and α-fucosidase (API ZYM).
The DNA G+C content is 44.2 mol%.
The major menaquinone is MK-7 and the predominant cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH and iso-C15 : 0 2-OH and/or C16 : 1ω7c.
The type strain, 15-52T (=KACC 11317T=DSM 18130T), was isolated from the rhizosphere of Chinese cabbage (Brassica campestris L.).
